meanings.definition: To come close in quantity or quality
meanings.sent1: The student's answer approximates the correct solution.
meanings.sent2: The temperature outside approximates the forecasted high for the day.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to catch the laser pointer approximates a stealth mission.
meanings.sent4: Her singing voice approximates that of a professional opera singer.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushwork approximates the style of a famous painter.

meanings.definition: An estimate or rough calculation of a value
meanings.sent1: The engineer provided an approximate of the project cost.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to give an approximate of the number of books in the library.
meanings.sent3: The child's guess of the number of candies in the jar was just an approximate.
meanings.sent4: The detective made an approximate of the suspect's height based on the security footage.
meanings.sent5: The doctor gave an approximate of the recovery time after the surgery.

meanings.sent1: The map was only an approximate representation of the hiking trail.
meanings.sent2: The estimated time of arrival was just an approximate.
meanings.sent3: The approximate weight of the pumpkin was written on the label.
meanings.sent4: The scientist's theory was an approximate explanation of the phenomenon.
meanings.sent5: The dress size she chose was only an approximate fit, but it worked well for the occasion.
